Workshop on Building Web-enabled Geospatial Analytics Applications with R Shiny

In this workshop, you will learn the basic principles and methods of R Shiny.

Published

August 15, 2025

Content

  • Motivation of developing web-enabled applications
    • Basic principles of web applications
  • Introducing R Shiny
    • Getting to know Shiny
    • Architecture of Shiny
    • Building block of Shiny app
  • Advanced R Shiny
    • Reactive feature of Shiny
    • Build interactive Shiny application by using plotly R
    • Build static, interactive and reactive geovisualisation application by using tmap
  • Managing R Shiny Project
    • The basic development cycle of creating apps
    • Debug errors in the codes
    • Build complex Shiny application using module
    • Improve the productivity of Shiny applications development
  • Deploying Shiny Application
    • Deploy to the cloud: shinyapps.io
    • Deploy on-premises (open source): Shiny Server
    • Deploy on-premises (commercial): RStudio Connect

Workshop Slides and Hands-on Notes

  • Introducing R Shiny slides in html and pdf formats

  • Advanced R Shiny I slides in html and pdf formats

  • Managing R Shiny Project slides in html and pdf formats

Must Do!

  • View the three parts series of Shiny Tutorial at this link.

Readings

Core Readings

  • Shiny reference guide at CRAN.
  • Hadley Wickham (2021) Mastering Shiny, Oâ€™Reilly Media. This is a highly recommended book. You can find the online version with this link.
  • Paula Moraga (2020) Geospatial Health Data: Modeling and Visualization with R-INLA and Shiny, Chapman & Hall/CRC. Chapter 13, 14 and 15.

  • Outstanding User Interfaces with Shiny.
  • How to Build a Shiny Application from Scratch.
